HelpGeneralDescription: Welcome to the Counting Bot! This bot allows you to set up counting channels in your server.
HelpGeneralFeaturesContent:
‚Ä¢ Multiple counting channels with different number systems
‚Ä¢ User profiles and statistics tracking
‚Ä¢ Leaderboards (server and global)
‚Ä¢ Achievements system
‚Ä¢ Customizable permissions
‚Ä¢ Multiple language support
HelpGeneralSupportContent: If you need help, join our support server or check out our documentation.
HelpSetupDescription: Follow these steps to set up the counting bot in your server:
HelpSetupStep1Content:
Use the `/setup` command to set up a counting channel:
```
/setup [channel] [number system]
```
Example: `/setup #counting decimal`
HelpSetupStep2Content:
Use the `/config` command to configure bot settings:
```
/config [setting] [value]
```
Example: `/config MathEnabled true`
HelpSetupStep3Content:
Use the `/set_permission` command to control who can use specific commands:
```
/set_permission [command] [user/role]
```
Example: `/set_permission setup_command @Moderator`
HelpSetupStep4Content: Your counting channel is now ready! Start by typing `1` in the channel.
HelpUserCommandsContent:
`/ping` - Check the bot's response time and uptime
`/profile` - View your profile statistics
`/stats` - View your detailed counting statistics
`/achievements` - View your unlocked achievements
`/leaderboard` - View the counting leaderboard
`/calculate` - Evaluate a mathematical expression
`/language` - Set your preferred language
`/reset` - Reset your profile information
`/help` - Display this help information
HelpAdminCommandsContent:
`/setup` - Set up a counting channel
`/config` - Configure bot settings
`/setprefix` - Set the bot's prefix
`/setcount` - Set the current count for a channel
HelpPermissionCommandsContent:
`/set_permission` - Allow users/roles to use commands
`/get_permission` - View command permissions
`/remove_permission` - Remove allowed users/roles
`/set_blacklist` - Blacklist users/roles from commands
`/remove_blacklist` - Remove blacklisted users/roles
HelpPermissionsDescription: The bot uses a permission system to control who can use specific commands. Here's how it works:
HelpPermissionsBasicsContent:
‚Ä¢ By default, most commands can be used by anyone
‚Ä¢ Admin commands require administrator permissions
‚Ä¢ You can restrict commands to specific users or roles
‚Ä¢ You can blacklist users or roles from using commands
HelpPermissionsSettingContent:
Use `/set_permission` to allow specific users or roles to use a command:
```
/set_permission [command] [user/role]
```
Once permissions are set, only specified users/roles can use the command.
HelpPermissionsBlacklistContent:
Use `/set_blacklist` to prevent specific users or roles from using a command:
```
/set_blacklist [command] [user/role]
```
Blacklisted users/roles cannot use the command, even if they have permission.
HelpPermissionsManagingContent:
‚Ä¢ `/get_permission` - View current permissions for a command
‚Ä¢ `/remove_permission` - Remove a user/role from allowed list
‚Ä¢ `/remove_blacklist` - Remove a user/role from blacklist
HelpCountingDescription: Learn how counting works and the rules to follow:
HelpCountingRulesContent:
‚Ä¢ Users take turns counting up from 1
‚Ä¢ Each number must be exactly one higher than the previous
‚Ä¢ The same user can count multiple times in a row
‚Ä¢ If someone makes a mistake, counting restarts from 1
‚Ä¢ You can use revives to save the count after a mistake
HelpCountingSystemsContent:
The bot supports different number systems:
‚Ä¢ **Decimal** - Regular numbers (1, 2, 3...)
‚Ä¢ **Binary** - Base-2 (1, 10, 11, 100...)
‚Ä¢ **Hexadecimal** - Base-16 (1, 2... 9, A, B, C, D, E, F, 10...)
HelpCountingMathContent:
If enabled, you can use math expressions when counting:
‚Ä¢ `2+2` (equals 4)
‚Ä¢ `3*2` (equals 6)
‚Ä¢ `10-5` (equals 5)
The result must equal the next number in the sequence.
HelpCountingRevivesContent:
When someone makes a mistake, you can use a revive to continue counting:
‚Ä¢ Each user has up to 3 revives
‚Ä¢ Revives are earned through regular counting
‚Ä¢ Use a revive by clicking the revive button that appears after a mistake

HelpSectionSetupDescription: How to set up the bot
